title: Tyson Fury gives first glimpse at 'very, very catchy' Robbie Williams Christmas duet

Tyson Fury has revealed Robbie Williams approached him backstage about starring in a Christmas duet.

British heavyweight boxer Fury and Williams are the favourites to land this year's Christmas No.1 - ahead of Ed Sheeran and Lewis Capaldi.

Fury confirmed the song, called Bad Sharon, is "very, very catchy" during his appearance on Good Morning Britain on Friday.

Asked about the song, Fury said: "Robbie was in town. He came to a fight in Las Vegas and came backstage.

"He said he had seen me doing little bits and asked if I would be interested."

(Image: Instagram/GypsyKing101)

"I am looking forward to it being released as it is very catchy.

"It is very British themed and people are going to enjoy it."

Fury claimed the song told the story of an office Christmas party - with the lyrics: "Grab that Sharon from the office. Nick the champagne, let’s get off it.”

The boxer added: "You can just imagine that coming on in a restaurant or a bar or while you’re out Christmas shopping.”

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

Fury meanwhile has made a foray into WWE and takes on Braun Strowman in Saudi Arabia at Crown Jewel next week.

He was attacked during training by the WWE superstar this week, leading to fears over an ankle injury.

"I was training in the ring, minding my own business and he came out of nowhere and my neck is still killing me now," he said.

"I hurt my ankle but it wasn't too damaging.

"It was more annoying because he came out of nowhere and I didn't see him coming."
description: Tyson Fury will team up with Robbie Williams for the festive hit, which is already being tipped to be Christmas No.1
